trans-unit.source: Creates a set of features based on a counts table
trans-unit.target: Creates a set of features based on a counts table

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Count Featurizer</ui> module to create features from a previously generated count table.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Count Featurizer</ui> module to create features from a previously generated count table.

trans-unit.source: Creating features from counts is an efficient way of summarizing useful information about the distribution of data and labels in a set of training data.
trans-unit.target: Creating features from counts is an efficient way of summarizing useful information about the distribution of data and labels in a set of training data.

trans-unit.source: This method of creating features from raw data is particularly useful in large data sets with high-cardinality features.
trans-unit.target: This method of creating features from raw data is particularly useful in large data sets with high-cardinality features.

trans-unit.source: For example, in fraud detection, count tables can be used to collect information about the user ID, product and transaction and all the possible combinations over terabytes of data.
trans-unit.target: For example, in fraud detection, count tables can be used to collect information about the user ID, product and transaction and all the possible combinations over terabytes of data.

trans-unit.source: Count tables can also be useful in improving accuracy on small data sets.
trans-unit.target: Count tables can also be useful in improving accuracy on small data sets.

trans-unit.source: You generate the count tables using the <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count Table</link> module together with a training dataset, and then use <ui>Count Featurizer</ui> to create a ranked set of features that can be used with any of the <legacyLink xlink:href="0c67013c-bfbc-428b-87f3-f552d8dd41f6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">machine learning modules</legacyLink> as an input for training.
trans-unit.target: You generate the count tables using the <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count Table</link> module together with a training dataset, and then use <ui>Count Featurizer</ui> to create a ranked set of features that can be used with any of the <legacyLink xlink:href="0c67013c-bfbc-428b-87f3-f552d8dd41f6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">machine learning modules</legacyLink> as an input for training.

trans-unit.source: You can also enhance your count-based features by:
trans-unit.target: You can also enhance your count-based features by:

trans-unit.source: Generating a count table, saving it, and then updating it with new data.
trans-unit.target: Generating a count table, saving it, and then updating it with new data.

trans-unit.source: Creating a master count table over time, which can be applied to multiple models.
trans-unit.target: Creating a master count table over time, which can be applied to multiple models.

trans-unit.source: Saving featurization steps for reuse with other data sets.
trans-unit.target: Saving featurization steps for reuse with other data sets.

trans-unit.source: For new experiments, we recommend that you use the following modules:
trans-unit.target: For new experiments, we recommend that you use the following modules:

trans-unit.source: For backward compatibility with existing experiments, the following modules can help you update an existing count table, or change the count table to a new count transformation.
trans-unit.target: For backward compatibility with existing experiments, the following modules can help you update an existing count table, or change the count table to a new count transformation.

trans-unit.source: Create a table of counts using the <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count Table</link> module.
trans-unit.target: Create a table of counts using the <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count Table</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Connect the output of the <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count Table</link> module to the leftmost input port of <ui>Count Featurizer</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Connect the output of the <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count Table</link> module to the leftmost input port of <ui>Count Featurizer</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Connect a training data set to the middle input port of <ui>Count Featurizer</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Connect a training data set to the middle input port of <ui>Count Featurizer</ui>.

trans-unit.source: It need not be the same training dataset that was used for <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count Table</link>, but you must select the same number of columns and they must have the same data type and values.
trans-unit.target: It need not be the same training dataset that was used for <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count Table</link>, but you must select the same number of columns and they must have the same data type and values.

trans-unit.source: Set additional options using the parameters in the following table.
trans-unit.target: Set additional options using the parameters in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns in the count table that you created using <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count table</link>.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns in the count table that you created using <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count table</link>.

trans-unit.source: You can select any subset of the columns used in the <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count Table</link> module.
trans-unit.target: You can select any subset of the columns used in the <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build Count Table</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns in the input dataset that you want to featurize by using the data from the count table.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns in the input dataset that you want to featurize by using the data from the count table.

trans-unit.source: You must select the same number of columns that you selected in the previous option, <legacyItalic>Select counted columns</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: You must select the same number of columns that you selected in the previous option, <legacyItalic>Select counted columns</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: The columns you select must have the same type and structure as the columns you used to build the count table.
trans-unit.target: The columns you select must have the same type and structure as the columns you used to build the count table.

trans-unit.source: Type a value to use as the garbage bin threshold.
trans-unit.target: Type a value to use as the garbage bin threshold.

trans-unit.source: This value specifies the minimum number of occurrences that must be found for each value, in order for counts to be used.
trans-unit.target: This value specifies the minimum number of occurrences that must be found for each value, in order for counts to be used.

trans-unit.source: If the frequency of the value is less than the garbage bin threshold, the value-label pair is not counted.
trans-unit.target: If the frequency of the value is less than the garbage bin threshold, the value-label pair is not counted.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a small dataset and you are counting and training on the same data, a good starting value is 1.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a small dataset and you are counting and training on the same data, a good starting value is 1.

trans-unit.source: Specify some <math>n</math> number of additional pseudo examples to include.
trans-unit.target: Specify some <math>n</math> number of additional pseudo examples to include.

trans-unit.source: The pseudo examples are generated based on the prior distribution.
trans-unit.target: The pseudo examples are generated based on the prior distribution.

trans-unit.source: Type a positive floating-point value that represents the scale used for introducing noise sampled from a Laplacian distribution.
trans-unit.target: Type a positive floating-point value that represents the scale used for introducing noise sampled from a Laplacian distribution.

trans-unit.source: It is statistically safe to count and train on the same data set if you set the Laplacian noise scale parameter.
trans-unit.target: It is statistically safe to count and train on the same data set if you set the Laplacian noise scale parameter.

trans-unit.source: In other words, by setting a scale value, some acceptable level of noise is incorporated into the model, so the model is less likely to be affected by unseen values in data.
trans-unit.target: In other words, by setting a scale value, some acceptable level of noise is incorporated into the model, so the model is less likely to be affected by unseen values in data.

trans-unit.source: Choose the count-based features that you want to include in the module output.
trans-unit.target: Choose the count-based features that you want to include in the module output.

trans-unit.source: Creates features using the log of the odds ratio.
trans-unit.target: Creates features using the log of the odds ratio.

trans-unit.source: Creates features using both counts and log odds.
trans-unit.target: Creates features using both counts and log odds.

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you want to ignore the <languageKeyword>IsBackOff</languageKeyword> column in the output when creating features
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you want to ignore the <languageKeyword>IsBackOff</languageKeyword> column in the output when creating features

trans-unit.source: You can see examples of how this module is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: You can see examples of how this module is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>flight delay prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525277</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates the use of count-based featurization over a very large dataset.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>flight delay prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525277</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates the use of count-based featurization over a very large dataset.

trans-unit.source: It is statistically safe to count and train on the same data set if you set the Laplacian noise scale parameter.
trans-unit.target: It is statistically safe to count and train on the same data set if you set the Laplacian noise scale parameter.

trans-unit.source: The data set to be featurized.
trans-unit.target: The data set to be featurized.

trans-unit.source: Provide additional pseudo examples following prior distribution, to include with the counts.
trans-unit.target: Provide additional pseudo examples following prior distribution, to include with the counts.

trans-unit.source: Specify the threshold under which a column value will be featurized against the garbage bin.
trans-unit.target: Specify the threshold under which a column value will be featurized against the garbage bin.

trans-unit.source: Indicate whether the IsBackOff column should be ignored when creating results.
trans-unit.target: Indicate whether the IsBackOff column should be ignored when creating results.

trans-unit.source: Specify a scale to apply when introducing noise sampled from Laplacian distribution.
trans-unit.target: Specify a scale to apply when introducing noise sampled from Laplacian distribution.

trans-unit.source: Select the features to include in the output.
trans-unit.target: Select the features to include in the output.

trans-unit.source: This must be a subset of the counted columns.
trans-unit.target: This must be a subset of the counted columns.

trans-unit.source: Select the columns that have been used to build count table.
trans-unit.target: Select the columns that have been used to build count table.

trans-unit.source: For a list of all exceptions, see <link xlink:href="38cc86bd-4223-4e8b-b23e-4d4fbf3a5620" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Module Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of all exceptions, see <link xlink:href="38cc86bd-4223-4e8b-b23e-4d4fbf3a5620" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Module Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
